results.title: Taṇhā sutta - Craving
results.description: The Buddha describes craving as a pervasive net that entangles the mind. He analyzes thirty-six modes of mental stirring—eighteen internal ways of conceiving the self and eighteen external ways of ide

results.title: Taṇhā sutta - Craving
results.description: The Buddha describes the three kinds of craving - 1) craving for sensual pleasures, 2) craving for becoming, and 3) craving for non-becoming.

results.title: Taṇhā vagga - Chapter 24 - Craving

results.title: Taṇhāsaṅkhaya sutta - Extinction of Craving
results.description: Observing Aññāsi Koṇḍañña reviewing his liberation from craving, the Buddha utters an inspired verse praising the arahant who is rootless, unbound, and beyond reproach.

results.title: Taṇhāsaṁyojana sutta - Fettered By Craving
results.description: The Buddha describes the fetter of craving as the most significant bond, bound by which, beings continue wandering on in cyclic existence.

results.title: Mahā taṇhāsaṅkhaya sutta - The Greater Discourse on the Exhaustion of Craving

results.title: Titthāyatana sutta - Bases Of Sectarian Views
results.description: The Buddha explains the three bases of sectarian views that when closely examined, culminate in inaction. He then shares the Dhamma that is irrefutable, undefiled, blameless, and not disapproved of by

results.title: Taṇhuppāda sutta - Uprisings of Craving
results.description: The Buddha describes the four uprisings of craving that can arise in a bhikkhu - 1) for a robe, 2) alms food, 3) lodging, and 4) for this or that state of existence.

results.title: Dhammacakkappavattana sutta - Setting in Motion of the Wheel of Dhamma

results.title: Tatiya jana sutta - Gives Rise To (Third)
results.description: A deity asks the Buddha what gives rise to a person, what does he have that wanders about, what experiences cyclic existence, and what determines this person‘s destiny.

results.title: Paṭhama jana sutta - Gives Rise To (First)
results.description: A deity asks the Buddha what gives rise to a person, what does he have that wanders about, what experiences cyclic existence, and what is this person‘s great fear.

results.title: Dutiya jana sutta - Gives Rise To (Second)
results.description: A deity asks the Buddha what gives rise to a person, what does he have that wanders about, what experiences cyclic existence, and from what is this person not yet freed.

results.title: Kaccānagotta sutta - With Kaccānagotta

results.title: Papañcakhaya sutta - Wearing Away of Mental Proliferation
results.description: The Buddha expresses an inspired utterance after reflecting on his giving up of the perceptions and notions [born of] mental proliferation.

results.title: Kuṭikā sutta - Little Hut
results.description: Do you have a little hut, a nest, or ties that extend? Are you freed from bondage?

results.title: Dutiya nibbānapaṭisaṁyutta sutta - Second Discourse on Nibbāna
results.description: The Buddha expresses an inspired verse on the uninclined nature of Nibbāna, which is hard to perceive.
